questions.question: A forest fire can have which of the following positive effects?

choices.answer: Provides heat mammals need in colder seasons
Increases annual rainfall by forming more clouds
Clears underbrush to allow new plants to grow
Drives away predators that eat smaller animals

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of how flooding can impact ecosystems?

choices.answer: Burial and uprooting of plants
Removing the leaves from tall trees
Increasing the nutrients in the soil
Preventing plants from photosynthesis

questions.question: Which event would result in the disappearance of plants & animals in a forest ecosystem?

choices.answer: A tornado
A volcanic eruption
A flash flood
An earthquake

questions.question: Hurricanes can harm plants in coastal ecosystems in all of the following ways EXCEPT

choices.answer: high winds knocking down tall trees.
soil washing away due to high water.
storm surge moving saltwater onto land.
clouds blocking the Sun for too long.

questions.question: The greater a habitat’s biodiversity, the greater will be that habitat’s

choices.answer: sustainability over time with varying conditions.
consumption of energy in the form of sunlight.
temperature ranges across the seasons.
distance to the nearest water source.

questions.question: Over time, a shallow pond fills with plants, such as duckweed and cattails. These plants

choices.answer: will die off quickly in the shallow water.
support ecological succession from pond to marshland.
will grow into larger trees as they mature.
eventually will dry out and create a fire hazard.

questions.question: Why does biodiversity contribute to a habitat’s sustainability?

choices.answer: The more plants and animals in a habitat greater the biomass
greater # of species the more competition between predators
Changes that harm one species leave other species to survive
Landforms change less  when there is greater # of species

questions.question: Habitats that receive little or no precipitation will likely be suitable for organisms that

choices.answer: hibernate for long periods of time.
are covered in thick fur to keep warm.
spend most of the day in the sunlight.
store large quantities of water internally.

questions.question: Which of the following most likely supports the most sustainable ecosystem?

choices.answer: The habitat with the greater number of green plants
The habitat with the greatest variety of living things
The habitat with the warmest average temperature
The habitat with the greatest number of consumers

questions.question: Ecological succession usually includes changes in all of thefollowing EXCEPT

choices.answer: the number of different kinds of plants.
the overall size of the dominant plants.
the number of plants of any one species
the rate at which species produce offspring.

questions.question: What does the increase in humans have on biodiversity of plant species  in the rainforest?

choices.answer: succession in the rainforest leads to increased biodiversity
diversity of larger rainforest plant species increases
the number of individual rainforest plant species increases
the diversity of all rainforest plant species decreases

questions.question: Which BEST explains why trees are the final stage in succession in this type of ecosystem?

choices.answer: Trees are large and use up all of the available nutrients.
Trees have deep roots and soak up all of the groundwater.
Small plants can't grow when trees block out sunlight.
Trees keep other plants from growing by using up the air.

questions.question: Which would likely be true where factors such as light and water are not restrictive?

choices.answer: an abundance of all the same type of producers
hard time sustaining any consumers
contain too many consumers
contain an abundance of a variety of producers

questions.question: Which would occur first in garden that is left empty?

choices.answer: development of topsoil
growth of weeds and grasses
growth of shrubs and trees
development of a stream

questions.question: Which plant characteristics are common to pioneer species?

choices.answer: plants with roots slowly break apart rocks
plants with long roots tap into deep water supplies
trees with exposed roots trap soil and vegetation
plants with a mat of surface roots quickly  soak up water

questions.question: All of the following are examples of secondary succession except

choices.answer: regrowth in a forest after a fire
growth of plants after a hurricane
lichen growing on a rock
a field transforming into a forest over time

questions.question: A newly formed lake in an area that has not previously been occupied is an example of:?

choices.answer: a deciduous forest
primary succession
climax community
secondary succession

questions.question: A word to describe an ecosystem where change in species appears to stop is called:

choices.answer: a climax community
primary succession
secondary succession
an ecological community

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of primary succession?

choices.answer: Bushes and trees gradually take root and populate a field.
Lichens, mosses and grasses begin to grow on bare rock.
A pond is gradually filled in by grasses and reeds.
A pine forest is  replaced by oak and hickory trees.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about tornadoes is NOT true?

choices.answer: Tornadoes can be associated with thunderstorms.
Tornadoes can have wind speeds over 150 miles per hour.
Tornadoes never actually touch the ground.
Tornadoes are common in hurricanes.

questions.question: Succession that occurs in an area that was previously barren is

choices.answer: secondary succession
primary succession
climax community
primary and secondary succession

questions.question: Weeds growing in a garden planted by humans are an example of

choices.answer: primary succession
an ecological community
secondary succession
climax community

questions.question: An example of secondary succession is

choices.answer: lichen growing on a rock
algae growing on a rock
growth in an area that was buried by lava from a volcano
regrowth in a forest after a fire

questions.question: A word that describes changes to the structure of an ecological community is

choices.answer: ecosystem
wetlands
climate
succession

questions.question: What happens when an ecosystem becomes less biodiverse?

choices.answer: The health of the ecosystem increases.
The health of the ecosystem decreases.
The health of the ecosystem remains the same.
The ecosystem cannot survive.
